ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Literally nothing. I cannot tell you a single thing I learned from this class.
I learned how to incorporate my own interests and perspectives into musical theater writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Fun class overall. I feel like I gained a lot of practice and insight on libretto writing, with a focus on music writing. However the course was highly disorganized, assignments werent super clear, and unfortunately the second half of the course the Professor was on zoom :(

WEAKNESSES:
- wildly disorganized
- weekend check-ins are stressful and annoying

STRENGTHS
- fun
- listen to cool music in class
- generous grades

This course was strong in its element of collaboration and music writing. Its weakness was a lack of organization and "direction" with the topics of the course. Sometimes, it felt like the exercises we engaged with did not all string together but were separate modules.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you don't mind constant disorganization, yes. It can be fun if you're already good at songwriting for musical theater. It also doesn't punish beginners, so as long as you find the work fun you'll have a good time. Collaboration can be really frustrating though, and it is the core purpose of the class, so be wary of that. You won't learn anything in this class, but you can write a few songs and hear some songs from your classmates which is fun.
Yes! It is a great opportunity to meet others interested in musical theater writing. Seeing others' work performed at the end of the semester and during class inspired me greatly.
